Expectation1: Maintain a friendly and approachable demeanor
Situation1: The acquaintance encounters a person who is visibly upset and crying about a recent event.
Expectation2: Maintain a safe and O39ean work environment.
Situation2: You notice a small, contained liquid spill in a walkway that needs to be O39eaned up immediately to prevent slips.
Story: I was on my lunch break, sitting on the edge of the construction site, when I saw Lisa from the apartment next door. She was standing by the fence, her shoulders shaking, tears streaming down her face. Instinctively, I wanted to go over, offer a kind word, maybe just listen—after all, that’s what a decent acquaintance should do. But as I stood up, I caught sight of a slick, shiny puddle right in the middle of the walkway where the crew would be returning any minute. My supervisor’s voice echoed in my head: “Any spill, no matter how small, gets cleaned up right away. Safety first.” I felt torn, my feet rooted to the spot. Lisa needed someone, but so did my team—if someone slipped, it’d be on me. My heart pounded as I glanced between her and the spill, feeling the weight of both expectations pressing in, unsure which way to turn.
